intro: Spiesia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in triads, giving it its common name. Spiesia triflora is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny, dry environments.
